result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase E Graff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid within 180 days or penalty of 2 days Huber for non-payment.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 5:00 p.m. on 5/12/2017.
AMENDED 7/21/2017:  SENTENCE CREDIT FOR 6 DAYS WERE GRATNED.

Defendant Chase E Graff in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Victim makes statements. Atty. Kershek makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:

45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 5:00 p.m. on 5/12/17.

COSTS:  $253.00 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid within 180 days. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 2 days in Huber.

eligible for public defender.

Defendant Chase E Graff in court.  David John Behm and Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is trying to formulate a defense with an attorney.  Defendant has been told many times he has options and time to get an attorney and he has not done so.  Attorney Will advises she has spoken to a civil attorney in the civil matter connected to this case.  Defendant does not wish to represent himself for trial.  Defendant makes statements regarding his civil matter freezing his assets and ability to generate income.  Court orders the defendant to come back to court every day until he gets an attorney.  Trial remains on the calendar.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Case recalled at 10:56 am.  Defendant returned to court to advise he is eligible for a public defender.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Chase E Graff in court.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant decided not to hire an attorney and is waiting on a response to his counter offer. Jury status hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chase E Graff in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to hire a public defender.  Case is not resolved.  This case stays on for trial.  Court orders the defendant go directly to the public defenders office right now and return at 11:00 today.  Case recalled at 9:48 am.  Defendant is not eligible for a public defender.  Defendant moves to have counsel appointed.  Court finds the defendant not indigent and denies the appointment of counsel.  Court adjourns this matter so the defendant can get counsel.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
